meanings.definition: To be completely exhausted or worn out.
meanings.sent1: After running a marathon, I felt completely scowdered.
meanings.sent2: She scowdered herself after a long day of work.
meanings.sent3: The tired puppy scowdered into a deep sleep.
meanings.sent4: The old car scowdered to a stop on the side of the road.
meanings.sent5: The hiker was scowdered after climbing the steep mountain.

meanings.definition: To be completely defeated or overwhelmed.
meanings.sent1: The team was scowdered by their opponents in the final match.
meanings.sent2: He scowdered his rival in the chess game.
meanings.sent3: The students were scowdered by the difficult exam.
meanings.sent4: The waves scowdered the sandcastle built by the children.
meanings.sent5: The army was scowdered by the enemy's surprise attack.

meanings.definition: To be completely confused or disoriented.
meanings.sent1: The new instructions scowdered the employees.
meanings.sent2: She scowdered her classmates with a tricky riddle.
meanings.sent3: The maze scowdered the adventurous explorers.
meanings.sent4: The complex puzzle scowdered the young child.
meanings.sent5: The foreign language scowdered the tourists trying to ask for directions.
